name: Aluminium chloride
desc: Aluminium chloride (AlCl3) is the main compound of aluminium and chlorine. It is white, but samples are often contaminated with iron(III) chloride, giving it a yellow color. The solid has a low melting and boiling point. It is mainly produced and consumed in the production of aluminium metal, but large amounts are also used in other areas of chemical industry. The compound is often cited as a Lewis acid. It is an example of an inorganic compound that "cracks" at mild temperature, reversibly changing from a polymer to a monomer.
Appearance:
white or pale yellow solid,
hygroscopic
Solubility:
soluble in hydrogen chloride, ethanol, chloroform, carbon tetrachloride
slightly soluble in benzene
LD50 (median dose):
